xmlNodePtr UXML2Document::addComment ( const char *  content  )  [inline]

Append a new comment node.

Parameters:
content The text. This should be unescaped
Returns:
The new comment node.
xmlNodePtr UXML2Document::createRootNode ( const char *  name,
const char *  ns_uri = 0,
const char *  ns_prefix = 0 
) [inline]

Creates the root node.

Parameters:
name The node's name.
ns_uri The namespace URI. A namspace declaration will be added to this node, because it could not have been declared before.
ns_prefix The namespace prefix to associate with the namespace. If no namespace prefix is specified then the namespace URI will be the default namespace.
Returns:
A pointer to the new root node
xmlNodePtr UXML2Document::createRootNodeByImport ( const xmlNodePtr  node,
bool  recursive = true 
) [inline]

Creates a root node by importing the node from another document, without affecting the source node.

Parameters:
node The node to copy and insert as the root node of the document
recursive Whether to import the child nodes also. Defaults to true.
Returns:
A pointer to the new root node
xmlNodePtr UXML2Document::findNode ( const xmlNodePtr  parent,
const xmlChar *  name,
const xmlChar *  ns 
)

Searches all children of the node having given name and namespace href.

Parameters:
parent the pointer to XML node.
name the name.
ns the namespace href (may be NULL).
Returns:
the pointer to the found node or NULL if an error occurs or node is not found.
const char* UXML2Document::getEncoding (  )  const [inline]
Returns:
The encoding used in the source from which the document has been loaded.
xmlEntityPtr UXML2Document::getEntity ( const char *  name  )  [inline, protected]

Retrieve an Entity.

The entity can be from an external subset or internally declared.

Parameters:
name Then name of the entity to get.
Returns:
A pointer to the libxml2 entity structure.
xmlNodePtr UXML2Document::getRootNode (  )  const [inline]

Return the root node.

This function does _not_ create a default root node if it doesn't exist.

Returns:
A pointer to the root node if it exists, 0 otherwise.
xmlEntityPtr UXML2Document::setEntityDeclaration ( const char *  name,
xmlEntityType  type,
const char *  publicId,
const char *  systemId,
const char *  content 
) [inline]

Add an Entity declaration to the document.

Parameters:
name The name of the entity that will be used in an entity reference.
type The type of entity.
publicId The public ID of the subset.
systemId The system ID of the subset.
content The value of the Entity. In entity reference substitutions, this is the replacement value.
bool UXML2Document::writeToFile ( const char *  filename,
const char *  encoding = 0,
bool  formatted = false 
)

Write the document to a file.

Parameters:
filename 
encoding If not provided, UTF-8 is used
formatted The output is formatted by inserting whitespaces, which is easier to read for a human, but may insert unwanted significant whitespaces. Use with care !
xmlChar * UXML2Document::writeToString ( int &  length,
const char *  encoding = 0,
bool  formatted = false 
)

Write the document to the memory.

Parameters:
encoding If not provided, UTF-8 is used
formatted The output is formatted by inserting whitespaces, which is easier to read for a human, but may insert unwanted significant whitespaces. Use with care !
Returns:
The written document.
UString UXML2Document::xmlC14N ( int  mode = 0,
int  with_comments = 0,
unsigned char **  inclusive_namespaces = 0 
)

Canonical XML implementation (http://www.w3.org/TR/2001/REC-xml-c14n-20010315)

Enum xmlC14NMode { XML_C14N_1_0 = 0 : Origianal C14N 1.0 spec XML_C14N_EXCLUSIVE_1_0 = 1 : Exclusive C14N 1.0 spec XML_C14N_1_1 = 2 : C14N 1.1 spec }
